purpleculture_pinyin:
chuǎng
to rush; to charge; to dash; to break through; to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
Торопить; заряжать; броситься; прорваться; закаливать себя (преодолевать трудности)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 闯)
Ideographic: A horse 馬 charging through a gate 門
purpleculture_examples:
闖蕩 [ chuǎng dàng ]: to leave home to work; to get away from home; to wander the world; well-traveled; adventurous
闖紅燈 [ chuǎng hóng dēng ]: to run a red light; failing to stop at a red traffic light; (slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
闖關 [ chuǎng guān ]: to crash through a barrier
闖禍 [ chuǎng huò ]: to cause an accident; to make trouble; to get into trouble

heisig_chinese_memo: As soon as the gates open the horses rush out.
Ru_trainchinese: chuǎng: (глаг) бросаться (куда-то); закалять себя; навлекать, вызывать (неприятности)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the horse (馬) at the gate (門) is inquiring
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: As soon as the gates open the horses rush out.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " horse ", from the " door ", it shows the appearance of the head and the probe. "Shuowen": "The horse goes out. From the horse is in the door. Read Ruochen." Tang Hanyu's "Nanshan Poem": "Sweeping the fish through the ping, and falling down on the moon."

" Crush " can mean break in. Song Li Zengbo "Xie Yubi Jie Yuying Generals and Other Events": "Recently, I heard that the Detective Cavalry had already entered the Huaiyin, and it was decided in a period of ten months. That is, there will be a policeman."

" Crushing " also means rushing. "Journey to the West" Chapter 84: "Only those who do have the heart to cause trouble."

" Chuang " also means running around to make a living. "The Scholars" Chapter 1: "When you see the book guest who breaks into the school, I will buy a few old books."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " horse ", from the " door ", it shows the appearance of the head and the probe.
humanum_full_description:
從「馬」，從「門」，表示出頭、探頭之貌。《說文》：「馬出門皃。从馬在門中。讀若郴。」 唐韓愈〈南山詩〉：「喁喁魚闖萍，落落月經宿。」

　　「闖」可表示突入。宋李曾伯〈謝御筆戒諭兵將等事奏〉：「近聞探騎已闖淮垠，決在旬月之間，即有風塵之警。」

　　「闖」也表示猛衝。《西遊記》第84回：「惟行者有心闖禍。」

　　「闖」還表示奔走謀生。《儒林外史》第1回：「見那闖學堂的書客，就買幾本舊書。」
humanum_short_description: 從「馬」，從「門」，表示出頭、探頭之貌。

(Simplified: 闯)
Ideographic: A horse 馬 charging through a gate 門
HSK: 5
Kanshudo mnemonic:the horse (馬) at the gate (門) is inquiring
Chinese: As soon as the gates open the horses rush out.
Meaning: rush
Hanzi: 闯
Story: As soon as the gates open the horses rush out.
Kind: traditional

從「 馬 」，從「 門 」，表示出頭、探頭之貌。《說文》：「馬出門皃。从馬在門中。讀若郴。」 唐韓愈〈南山詩〉：「喁喁魚闖萍，落落月經宿。」 「 闖 」可表示突入。宋李曾伯〈謝御筆戒諭兵將等事奏〉：「近聞探騎已闖淮垠，決在旬月之間，即有風塵之警。」 「 闖 」也表示猛衝。《西遊記》第84回：「惟行者有心闖禍。」 「 闖 」還表示奔走謀生。《儒林外史》第1回：「見那闖學堂的書客，就買幾本舊書。」
From the " horse", from the " door", it shows the appearance of the head and the probe. "Shuowen": "The horse goes out. From the horse is in the door. Read Ruochen." Tang Hanyu's "Nanshan Poem": "Sweeping the fish through the ping, and falling down on the moon." " Crush" can mean break in. Song Li Zengbo "Xie Yubi Jie Yuying Generals and Other Events": "Recently, I heard that the Detective Cavalry had already entered the Huaiyin, and it was decided in a period of ten months. That is, there will be a policeman." " Crushing" also means rushing. "Journey to the West" Chapter 84: "Only those who do have the heart to cause trouble." " Chuang" also means running around to make a living. "The Scholars" Chapter 1: "When you see the book guest who breaks into the school, I will buy a few old books."

闖字的基本解释

闖
chuǎng
见“闯”。

闖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chèn］
［《廣韻》丑禁切，去沁，徹。］
“闯1”的繁体字。
(1)出头貌。
(2)探头观望。
[②]［chuǎng］
“闯2”的繁体字。
(1)突然直入；猛冲。
(2)为一定目的而到处活动，奔走。
(3)闯练。
(4)开创出某种新的成果。
(5)惹起。
(6)方言。不耕而种。

闖字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　闖； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1340第08
【唐韻】【韻會】【正韻】?丑禁切，音?。【說文】馬出門貌。从馬在門中，會意亦象形。讀若郴。　又出頭貌。【公羊傳·哀六年】開之，則闖然公子陽生也。【註】闖，出頭貌。　又【玉篇】或作覘。【韓愈·同宿聯句】儒門雖大啓，姦首不敢闖。皆以窺覘爲義。　又【集韻】丑甚切，音踸。【公羊傳·哀六年闖然釋文】又丑衽反。　又【集韻】癡林切，音琛。義同。
